name: Playlist downloader
body:
### Requirement:  
Youtube-dl installed, support on:
 - [Documention](http://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/)
 - [Projects](https://github.com/rg3/youtube-dl)
 
I have also used and rougly adapt a piece of code for parsing a youtube playlist url, found [here](http://pantuts.com/2013/02/16/youparse-extract-urls-from-youtube/)

Execute this script in the directory in which songs have to be downloaded (e.g: Create a 'Myplaylist' directory and from the terminal):

```
$ cd /PathToMyPlaylist/Myplaylist  <= to be in the right directory
$ python /PathToTheScriptFolder/playlist_downloader/dl_ytpl_multi.py http://youtubePlaylistAdress.com/343424324... 
```

It creates a playlist.txt file, do not delete or edit this file if you don't want to 
download the same video each time you run the script (it records all downloaded viedos)
from a given playlist.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
